metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6405 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds read in SQLite in Google Chrome prior to 80.0.3987.87 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
